column4: I accidentally wiped my MBR by running the NT setup; how can I restore this to load Ubuntu's grub/lilo?
thanks... I will look on the Wiki next time :-)
I've now tried removing .gconf, .gconfd (it didn't exist), .gnome2, .gnome2_private. I then ctrl+alt+backspace, re-login and the problem persists.
logout, login in the console, clean out /tmp

I've removed all of those hidden config directories in my ~, then wiped out everything in /tmp, rebooted and gnome-panel still crashes. Is there anyway to delete my user account, then recreate it with a "default" gnome config?
sure, make sure you have a new account first
okay... my current username is "james" so I'll just create "jamey" and mv my old home dir *files* over
so just make sure I add it to the admin group?
thank you very much... it worked perfectly. :-)
